Bridget Klingler

Software Developer

About Me

Starting at the young age of 5, Bridget was introduced into the creative world of dance. Ever since then she has delved into multiple creative feilds including: webpage design, musical theater, clarinet, choreography, cooking, drawing, acting, writing, and crafts. She is excited about her new endeavor into coding and looks forward to what the future will bring with the new skills.

Along with her creative endeavors she also enjoys the worlds of sports and outdoor activities. She frequently kayaks with her husband and dog around the Cleveland area. An avid camper and hiker, she even backpacked Devil's Canyon in Grand Teton National Park while on a road trip vacation from Ohio to Yellowstone, camping through 7 states. She can frequently be found on the corner of Carnegie and Ontario cheering on her Cleveland Indians as a season ticket holder. An avid football fan, she has been a die hard through all the ups and (mostly) downs of her beloved Cleveland Browns and is excited for next season (but for real this time!).

Projects

JCP Payroll

Created a Single Page Application utilizing Entity Framework to populate a Sequel Database and used Node to access that information on the front end. Worked on a team of 6 and created our program in 2.5 weeks- featuring a individualized log-in, running clock, drop down selections, search bars, and calendars.

Space Program Mission Tracker

Worked as a pair to design a user-friendly Single Page Application to log space missions between Stellar Bodies and Space Agencies.

Garden Blog

Worked as a pair to design an MVC program where users could create blog posts under 2 categories. Featuring a working DateTime function to track when new posts were created on the webpage.

Virtual Pet

Created a C# program where the user could create an organic or robotic pet and store them in a shelter. We were very proud of our "hurt" method where we created a 10% chance the pet could get hurt when the choosing to play with their pet.

University Hospitals

Created a C# program where users could view lists of Medical and Non-Medical staff and choose to pay their employees. Kept a keen eye on structure and layout of the lists when running the program.
